title: Drawing, Design for Textile-Pillow Series #6, No.2170 (A,B,C), 1966
signed: In graphite lower right inside stamped office address block: ALEXANDER GIRARD / ARCHITECT / P.O. BOX 2168 SANTA FE, NEW MEXICO
inscribed: In graphite along lower edge under corresponding designs: No.2170-A "CROSS WITH FOUR SQUARES"; No.2170-B "DIAMOND SQUARES"; No.2170-C "CONCENTRIC SQUARES". At lower right in graphite inside an office address stamped block along right edge:   No.2170 (A,B,C) PILLOW SERIES No.6 / DATE:11-9-66 / SCALE: FULL SIZE / BY: LESTER / JOB NO. / DRAWING NO.
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Three linear patterns for pillows on one sheet. At the left, four squares nested inside four larger squares suggesting a cross pattern. The center pattern consists of one large square divided into diamonds and the pattern on the right consists of concentrically arranged squares.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Textile-Pillow Series #6, No.2170 (A,B,C), 1966. Graphite on white tracing paper. 
Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-415
